content:
Does anyone know where I can find this paper?

Borceux, F., ‘Sheaves of algebras for a commutative theory’, Ann. Soc. Sci. Bruxelles 95 (1981), 3–19.
The Internet seems to think this journal only existed until 1936!
There is a math review . And in our library it's listed as available "off-site". I requested a scan.

I guess the solution of the mystery is that Borceux published his paper in Annales de la Societé Scientifique de Bruxelles. Série I. Sciences Mathématiques, Astronomiques et Physiques, whereas there was a related earlier journal Annales de la Société scientifique de Bruxelles A. Sciences mathématiques that lasted only until 1936.

Jonas Frey said:

There is a math review . And in our library it's listed as available "off-site". I requested a scan.

OK it seems like CMU only has the journal issues until Vol 56, from 1936. According to the library website it's the same journal though.
I just noticed I have a paper from vol 93 of that journal from the CMU ILL.
I'll be in Louvain-la-Neuve next week so perhaps I can consult their library (or, at worst, Bruxelles'!)
I submitted an ILL (inter library loan) request!
